Search

Advanced Search Options

FIELDS

The following example searches for the term ‚Äúfoo‚Äù in the specified field:
title:foo or url:bar or content:baz

WILDCARDS

A wildcard is represented as an asterisk (*) and can appear anywhere in a search term. The following will match all documents with words beginning with ‚Äúfoo‚Äù or ending with "oo":
foo* or *oo

BOOSTS

In multi-term searches, a single term may be important than others. Any article that matches a boosted term will get a higher relevance score, and appear higher up in the results. The first example weights the term ‚Äúfoo‚Äù 10 times higher than the term ‚Äúbar‚Äù:
foo^10 bar or foo^10 bar^5 baz

FUZZY MATCHES

Can be helpful if the spelling of a term is unclear, or to increase the number of search results that are returned. The following search matches articles that have a word within 1 edit distance of ‚Äúfoo‚Äù:
foo~1
An edit distance of 1 allows words to match if either adding, removing, changing or transposing a character in the word would lead to a match. For example ‚Äúboo‚Äù requires a single edit (replacing ‚Äúf‚Äù with ‚Äúb‚Äù) and would match, but ‚Äúboot‚Äù would not as it also requires an additional ‚Äút‚Äù at the end.
